questions.question: An entrepreneur is primarily defined as:
options: Someone who works for a large corporation
A person who sets up a business and takes financial risks
An investor who provides funding for startups
A government official who regulates businesses
questions.correct_answer: A person who sets up a business and takes financial risks

questions.question: Entrepreneurship involves:
options: Only the ability to make a profit
The ability to develop, organize, and run a business with its uncertainties
Investing money in a business without active involvement
questions.correct_answer: The ability to develop, organize, and run a business with its uncertainties

questions.question: Creating value in entrepreneurship involves:
options: Implementing an idea that has no impact
Implementing an idea that makes an economic or social difference
questions.correct_answer: Implementing an idea that makes an economic or social difference

questions.question: Innovation refers to:
options: The process of copying existing products or services
The ability to make a profit
Translating ideas into valuable new products, processes, or services
The ability to manage a business effectively
questions.correct_answer: Translating ideas into valuable new products, processes, or services

questions.question: Incremental innovation involves:
options: Making small improvements to existing products, services, or processes
Creating entirely new products or services
questions.correct_answer: Making small improvements to existing products, services, or processes

questions.question: Benchmarking is a process used to:
options: Identify and learn from best practices in the industry
questions.correct_answer: Identify and learn from best practices in the industry

questions.question: Absorptive capacity refers to:
options: The ability of an organization to use existing knowledge effectively
The ability to measure employee satisfaction
The process of developing new products and services
An organization's ability to implement and use new knowledge from outside
questions.correct_answer: An organization's ability to implement and use new knowledge from outside

questions.question: Explicit knowledge is:
An innovation strategy is:
options: A statement of how innovation will take the business forward and why
A plan for reducing costs in a business
A marketing plan for a new product
A financial plan for a business
questions.correct_answer: A statement of how innovation will take the business forward and why

questions.question: Exploit innovation involves:
options: Making radical changes to existing products or services
Making incremental improvements to existing products or services
questions.correct_answer: Making incremental improvements to existing products or services

questions.question: Explore innovation involves:
options: Making incremental improvements to existing products or services

Why do organizations need social entrepreneurship?
One of the key challenges faced by social entrepreneurs is:
options: Strong alignment between social needs and revenue generation

questions.question: Creativity is:
options: The ability to follow rules and procedures
The ability to produce work that is both novel and useful
The ability to copy existing ideas
The ability to avoid taking risks
questions.correct_answer: The ability to produce work that is both novel and useful

questions.question: Creative ideas are important for:
Divergent thinking is associated with:
Convergent thinking can help to:
options: Evaluate and select the best solution
questions.correct_answer: Evaluate and select the best solution

options: The idea is refined and improved
